contentrichtext.text: '''Queso Chihuahua''' or '''Chihuahua cheese''' is a soft white [[cow]]'s-[[milk]] [[Cheeses of Mexico|cheese of Mexican]] origin available in braids, balls or rounds. The cheese is named after its place of origin, the Mexican state of [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]]. In Chihuahua, it is called '''queso menonita''', after the [[Mennonites in Mexico|Mennonite]] communities of northern Mexico that first produced it, while elsewhere it is called queso chihuahua.<ref name="Texas Monthly">{{cite journal|last=Coupon|first=William|title=Side By Side|journal=Texas Monthly|year=1989|month=April|volume=17|issue=4|pages=118â€“125|url=http://books.google.com/?id=TC4EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA119&dq=queso+chihuahua#v=onepage&q=queso%20chihuahua&f=false|accessdate=31 August 2011|publisher=Texas Monthly, Inc.|issn=0148-7736}}</ref><ref name="Authentic Mexican">{{cite book|last=Bayless|first=Rick|authorlink=Rick Bayless|title=Authentic Mexican: Regional Cooking from the Heart of Mexico|year=2007|publisher=William Morrow|isbn=978-0-06-137326-8|pages=327|url=http://books.google.com/?id=lCkXPPSrXXEC&pg=PT584&dq=queso+chihuahua#v=onepage&q=queso%20chihuahua&f=false|others=With Deann Groen Bayless}}</ref> This cheese is now made by both Mennonites and non-Mennonites throughout the state and is popular all over the country.{{Citation needed|date=May 2013}} Queso Chihuahua is good for melting, and is similar to a mild, white [[cheddar cheese|cheddar]] or [[Monterey Jack]].<ref name="Authentic Mexican"/> It may be used in [[queso fundido]] ([[fondue]] style melted cheese), [http://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/choriqueso choriqueso], [[quesadillas]], [[chilaquiles]], [[chili con queso]], or sauces.<ref name="gs">{{cite web|accessdate=2007-10-15|publisher=Gourmet Sleuth|title=Guide to Mexican Cheeses|url=http://www.gourmetsleuth.com/mexicancheeses.htm}}</ref> == See also == *[[Asadero]] == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Mexican cuisine]] [[Category:Mexican cheeses]] [[Category:Mennonitism in Mexico]] [[Category:Chihuahua]] {{cheese-stub}}
